marketNews.title: BI Rate Drops -25 Bps, Beyond Expectations
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia lowered the BI Rate by -25 bps to the level of 5.75% today, Wednesday (15/1), with the deposit facility and lending facility also decreasing by -25 bps to 5% and 6.5% respectively. This decision was outside the consensus expectations which anticipated the BI Rate would be maintained at 6%. Governor of Bank Indonesia, Perry Warjiyo, stated that the decision was made by considering the balance between the stability of the Rupiah exchange rate and Indonesia's economic growth. Bank Indonesia itself cut Indonesia's economic growth outlook for 2025 from the range of +4.8-5.6% YoY to +4.7-5.5% YoY following weakening consumption, employment, investment, and exports. For 4Q24 specifically, Bank Indonesia projects Indonesian economic growth to only be around +5-5.1% YoY. Meanwhile, Bank Indonesia expects inflation in 2025 and 2026 to remain low according to the previous target in the range of 1.5-3.5% YoY (vs. 2024 inflation: 1.57% YoY). The BI Rate cut occurred amidst the weakening of the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar in recent months, driven by geopolitical uncertainty, the direction of the new US government policy, and the strengthening of the higher-for-longer narrative regarding US interest rates. Bank Indonesia also lowered the expectation for Fed rate cuts during 2025 from -50 bps in November 2024 to only -25 bps following the potential hindrance of disinflation progress due to import duty hikes initiated by the US President-elect, Donald Trump. Bank Indonesia's expectation is in line with market expectations based on the CME Fedwatch Tool analysis as of Wednesday (15/1). Perry mentioned that clarity on policy direction from Trump and the Fed would help ease global volatility. To maintain the stability of the Rupiah exchange rate, Bank Indonesia will continue to intervene in the bond market, spot market, and domestic non-deliverable forward market, as well as optimize the Bank Indonesia Rupiah Securities (SRBI), Bank Indonesia Foreign Exchange Sukuk (SUVBI), and Bank Indonesia Foreign Exchange Securities (SVBI). Perry mentioned that Bank Indonesia is preparing SUVBI and SVBI as additional incentive instruments for the placement of foreign exchange from natural resource exports (DHE SDA), besides existing instruments such as FX term deposits and FX swaps. Previously, the Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated that the government would revise the minimum tenor for DHE SDA placement from 3 months to 1 year, a step aimed at increasing the supply of domestic foreign exchange to alleviate pressure on the Rupiah. Following the announcement of the BI Rate cut, the IHSG strengthened by +1.77% at the market close today, the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar weakened by -0.3% to the level of 16,320, and the 10-year government bond yield decreased by -0.4 bps to the level of 7.272%.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content:
The decision which was beyond expectations was welcomed positively by the market, with the IHSG recording a net foreign inflow of 580 billion Rupiah today and marking the first inflow since January 9, 2025. Sectors sensitive to interest rates - such as banking/finance (+3.12%) and property (+2.63%) - experienced significant increases.
- Banking: $BBRI (+7.63%), $BBNI (+6.78%), $BMRI (+6.48%), $BBCA (+2.89%)
- Property: $CTRA (+7.87%), $PWON (+5.26%), $BSDE (+5.03%), $SMRA (+3.57%)
Meanwhile, investors need to observe the release of US inflation data which will be announced on Wednesday (15/1) local time. Hawkish US inflation data has the potential to put more pressure on the Rupiah exchange rate.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia recorded that commercial bank credit disbursement growth slowed down to +10.39% YoY in 12M24 (vs. 11M24: +10.79% YoY), marking the lowest growth in the last 13 months although still in line with Bank Indonesia's target around +10-12%. Based on its use, investment credit grew +13.62% YoY, consumption credit +10.61% YoY, and working capital +8.35% YoY. Meanwhile, sharia financing during 12M24 grew +9.87% YoY and MSME credit growth reached +3.37% YoY. Bank Indonesia projects credit growth in 2025 will increase to the range of +11-13% YoY.
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia noted that commercial bank credit disbursement growth slowed down to the level of +10.39% YoY in 12M24 (vs. 11M24: +10.79% YoY), marking the lowest growth in the last 13 months although still in line with Bank Indonesia's target in the range of +10-12%. Based on its use, investment credit grew +13.62% YoY, consumption credit +10.61% YoY, and working capital +8.35% YoY. Meanwhile, sharia financing during 12M24 grew +9.87% YoY and MSME credit growth reached +3.37% YoY. Bank Indonesia projects credit growth in 2025 will increase to the range of +11-13% YoY.

marketNews.title: General Secretary of Gaikindo, Kukuh Kumara, said on Tuesday (14/1) that they are targeting car sales in the range of 750,000-900,000 units in 2025 (vs. 2024 wholesale realization: 865,723 units). This target considers economic uncertainty, the VAT increase to 12%, and the implementation of excise surcharges. The target announced by Gaikindo's Kukuh came only a few days after the First Chairman of Gaikindo, Jongkie Sugiarto, stated that they remain optimistic that car wholesale sales in 2025 will recover to the level of 1 million units.
marketNews.content: Secretary General of Gaikindo, Kukuh Kumara, said on Tuesday (14/1) that they are targeting car sales in the range of 750,000-900,000 units in 2025 (vs. 2024 wholesale realization: 865,723 units). This target considers economic uncertainty, the VAT increase to 12%, and the implementation of excise surcharges. The target announced by Kukuh of Gaikindo is only a few days after the First Chairman of Gaikindo, Jongkie Sugiarto, mentioned that they remain optimistic that car wholesale sales in 2025 will recover to the level of 1 million units.

marketNews.title: OJK Announced Several Housing Financing Policy Relaxations on Tuesday (14/1) to Support the Program of 3 Million Houses per Year
marketNews.content: OJK on Tuesday (14/1) announced several relaxations of housing financing policies to support the program of 3 million houses per year, namely: 1) quality assessment of housing loans (KPR) can be based only on payment accuracy, which is looser compared to other loans assessed based on business prospects, debtor performance, and ability to pay; 2) KPR can be subject to a low-risk weight and set granularly, with the lowest weight of 20% based on loan-to-value; and 3) revoking the ban on granting land procurement/processing loans which has been in effect since January 1, 2023. In addition, OJK also affirmed that there is no OJK provision that prohibits granting credit to debtors who have non-performing loans.

marketNews.title: Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, denied that the government plans to increase the portion of foreign exchange placement from natural resource exports (DHE SDA) to a minimum of 50% from a minimum of 30%.
marketNews.content: Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, denied that the government plans to raise the placement portion of foreign exchange from natural resource exports (DHE SDA) to a minimum of 50% from a minimum of 30%. Airlangga stated that the government is still discussing the revision of the DHE SDA placement portion. Rumors of increasing the DHE SDA portion were initially reported by Kontan early this year, which mentioned that the government would increase the portion and tenor of DHE SDA fund placement from a minimum of 30% for 3 months to a minimum of 50% for 6-12 months, with an interest incentive of up to 4.48%. Last week, Airlangga confirmed that the government would revise the minimum tenor for DHE SDA placement from 3 months to 1 year.

marketNews.title: BPS Recorded That Indonesia's Trade Balance Surplus Declined to 2.24 Billion US Dollars in December 2024 (vs. Dec 2023: 3.29 Billion USD Surplus, Nov 2024: 4.37 Billion USD Surplus), Lower Than Consensus Expectations That Predicted a 3.79 Billion USD Surplus.
marketNews.content: BPS recorded that Indonesia's trade balance surplus declined to the level of 2.24 billion US dollars in December 2024 (vs. Dec 2023: 3.29 billion US dollars surplus, Nov 2024: 4.37 billion US dollars surplus), lower than consensus expectations which projected a surplus of 3.79 billion US dollars. This result marks the smallest trade balance surplus since February 2024. The significant decrease in the surplus was pressured by a surge in imports (+11.07% YoY), while exports only grew +4.78% YoY. Cumulatively throughout 2024, Indonesia's trade balance surplus declined to 31.04 billion US dollars (vs. 2023: 36.89 billion US dollars surplus) as imports (+5.31% YoY) grew faster than the increase in exports (+2.29% YoY).

marketNews.title: The US Government Announced Plans to Restrict Chip and Artificial Intelligence (AI) Technology Exports to Dozens of Countries, No Longer Just to a Few Countries Long Identified as State Enemies.
marketNews.content: The US Government announced plans to restrict the export of chips and artificial intelligence (AI) technology to dozens of countries, no longer just to a few countries long identified as state enemies. The step is aimed at ensuring that the AI world runs according to the US plan and preventing the country from 'bad actors' who might use AI to threaten the US. The US Government stated that 18 allied countries and partners would be excluded from these restrictions. This restriction plan has entered the comment period and will take effect in less than 120 days. Kontan reported that Indonesia is included in the category of countries with limited access in the policy plan.

marketNews.title: BPS Recorded That the Poverty Rate in Indonesia in September 2024 Fell to 8.57% of the Total Population
marketNews.content: BPS recorded that the proportion of the poor population in Indonesia in September 2024 fell to the level of 8.57% of the total population, a decrease of -0.46 percentage point compared to March 2024 and -0.79 percentage point compared to March 2023. Nevertheless, BPS recorded that the expenditure inequality rate in Indonesia measured using the Gini ratio worsened to the level of 0.381 in September 2024, an increase of 0.002 points compared to March 2024 although a decrease of 0.007 points compared to March 2023.

tickerNews.title: CTRA: Marketing Sales +8% YoY in 2024, Equivalent to 99.2% of Target
tickerNews.content: $CTRA: Ciputra Development recorded marketing sales of 2.3 trillion Rupiah in 4Q24 (-10% QoQ, -4% YoY). This result brought marketing sales throughout 2024 to reach 11.02 trillion Rupiah (+8% YoY), equivalent to 99.2% of the 2024 target of 11.1 trillion Rupiah. CTRA linked this achievement to a geographic diversification strategy, with marketing sales in Sumatra growing significantly to 2.1 trillion Rupiah in 2024 (+85% YoY). Based on segment, landed houses and land sales contributed 82% of total 2024 marketing sales, followed by shophouses (13%), apartments (3%), and offices (2%).

tickerNews.title: CMNP Clarifies Receipt of Notice from Shareholders Regarding Main Shareholder Transfer Plan
tickerNews.content: $CMNP: Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company has not received any notification or correspondence from shareholders and the Salim group regarding the plan to transfer the main shareholder in the company. This clarification emerged after the ultimate beneficiary of CMNP, Jusuf Hamka, stated last week that the Salim group plans to become the main shareholder in his company and the share transfer process is currently underway. Jusuf also mentioned that the President Director of CMNP, Arief Budhy Hardono, is a person who has been active in the Salim group.

tickerNews.title: INTP: Cement Sales Volume Growth Supported by Java, Market Share Increases to 30.6%
tickerNews.content: $INTP: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa recorded cement sales volume growth (including Grobogan Cement) of +2% YoY in December 2024, with market share rising to 30.6% (vs. December 2023: 26.4%) due to the industry's cement sales volume declining by -12% YoY. INTP's sales volume growth in December 2024 was supported by Java (+4.1% YoY), with the Central Java region showing significant growth (+49% YoY) due to the consolidation of Grobogan Cement. This result brought INTP's cement sales volume throughout 2024 to grow +8.4% YoY to 18.9 million tons and increase by +5.5% YoY in 4Q24 to 5.2 million tons. Based on segment, bulk cement sales volume rose +29% YoY during 2024, while bagged cement grew +1.1% YoY.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Controller and Director Yulisar Khiat Buys 1.9 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: $HEAL: The controller and Director of Medikaloka Hermina, Yulisar Khiat, purchased 1.9 million HEAL shares at an average price of 1,608 Rupiah per share on January 7, 2025. The total transaction value reached 3 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, Yulisar Khiat's ownership in HEAL increased from 12.765% to 12.778%.

tickerNews.title: HGII: Shikoku Electric Power to Acquire 25% of HGII Shares Worth IDR 325 Billion After All Acquisition Requirements Are Met
tickerNews.content: $HGII: The President Director of Hero Global Investment, Robin Sunyoto, stated that all requirements for the takeover of 25% of HGII shares by Shikoku Electric Power Company Incorporated (Yonden Group, TYO: 9507) have been completed, so the transaction can be finalized in the next few days. In this transaction, Yonden Group will purchase 1.62 billion HGII shares at its IPO price of 200 Rupiah per share from the founding shareholders of HGII. Yonden Group is a power generation company with a total capacity of 5,332 MW sourced from hydro, thermal, nuclear, and solar power. Previously, Robin also said that HGII targeted to own and manage a renewable energy power plant (EBT) with a total capacity of 100 MW by 2031.

tickerNews.title: HAIS Targets Revenue and Net Profit Growth of Around +5-10% YoY in 2025, Supported by Fleet Expansion Plans with a CAPEX Allocation of IDR 260 Billion
tickerNews.content: $HAIS: The Finance Director of Hasnur Internasional Shipping, Rickie, stated that they are targeting revenue and net profit growth of approximately +5-10% YoY in 2025. Rickie mentioned that this target is supported by the potential increase in shipping demand, fleet expansion plans, and strengthening of the business ecosystem through collaboration with strategic partners. HAIS also plans to add 4 sets of tugboats and barges during 2025, with a capex allocation of about 260 billion Rupiah (vs. 2024 capex allocation: 250-300 billion Rupiah).
